intro: Conioselinum smithii, commonly known as Smith's wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly aromatic scent. Conioselinum smithii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
